field.name: summary
field.value: on version 3.1 VS 2010 C# - when adding a reference to a project - the other referenceing project will not get the Facilites assembly

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
Can you elaborate?
Which facility is this about?

comment.author: Guy.Cohen
comment.text:
I am upgrading from castle ver 2.5 to ver 3.x My settings: Visual studio 2010 .Net 4 Windows server 2008 I currently use an assembly which is a wrapper to the resolver issues Utilitiy.Reslove The other project should reference this Utilitiy.Reslove in order to resolve their components. Components are being copied OK to the Utility assembly bin after compilation. After compiling the solution the project I see that the 2 castle assembly’s .core and .windsor are being copied to the referencing location, but Castle.Facilities.FactorySupport.dll although being referenced in the Utilitiy assembly is not being copied. It’s declared just like the other 2 in the project file: <ItemGroup> <Reference Include="Castle.Core, Version=3.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=407dd0808d44fbdc, processorArchitecture=MSIL"> <SpecificVersion>False</SpecificVersion> <HintPath>..\..\..\packages\Castle.Core.3.0.0.4001\lib\net40-client\Castle.Core.dll</HintPath> </Reference> <Reference Include="Castle.Facilities.FactorySupport, Version=3.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=407dd0808d44fbdc, processorArchitecture=MSIL"> <SpecificVersion>False</SpecificVersion> <HintPath>..\..\..\packages\Castle.FactorySupportFacility.3.0.0.4001\lib\net40\Castle.Facilities.FactorySupport.dll</HintPath> </Reference> <Reference Include="Castle.Windsor, Version=3.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=407dd0808d44fbdc, processorArchitecture=MSIL"> <SpecificVersion>False</SpecificVersion> <HintPath>..\..\..\packages\Castle.Windsor.3.0.0.4001\lib\net40\Castle.Windsor.dll</HintPath> </Reference>
1. The way I build the assembly / solution may result in different result: If I use the build within the vs 2010 is be copied. But if I use a command prompt running msbuild command (with no special parameters) it’s not being copied – msbuild /t:clean;rebuild /p:Configuration=Debug /p:Platform="Any CPU" My.Framework.sln
It happens the same on both debug and release
2. The referencing project are not signed Web Application signed Class library 3. I got the castle Packages – via both direct download and Nuget 4. I tried on different castle projects Version 3.1(current) and 3.0 5. On the Castle packages I tried for .net 3.5 and .net 4 6. Components are registered via an xml and use the following configuration <castle> <facilities> <facility id="factory.support" type="Castle.Facilities.FactorySupport.FactorySupportFacility, Castle.Facilities.FactorySupport" /> </facilities> After reading your site I tried to remove the use of Facilities from the xml which cause runtime exception. 7. Reading: http://docs.castleproject.org/Windsor.Factory-Support-Facility.ashx I understand I can’t use UsingFactoryMethod with xml 8. Of course I’ve tried on several different computers

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: Hmm, I'm not sure what the problem is. Perhaps some MsBuild optimisation for unused references. If you add the facility in code does it still happen?
